newsitem.title: GERMANY: Air France in Hahn airport trucking hub.
newsitem.headline: Air France in Hahn airport trucking hub.

text.p: Air France said it is looking into opening a road feeder services Germany cargo hub at Hahn airport (HHN).
"We are studying a project at present. We want to see if we can do it," Air France Cargo Germany director, Helmut Scherret, told Reuters.
"It would be a cost-saving measure for trucking but I cannot say any more than that," he added.
The airline was still considering the project and it was too early to release any further details, Scherret stressed.
He declined to comment on a report in German financial newspaper Handelsblatt that the hub could handle 60,000 tonnes a year of air freight and that it could go into operation next spring.
Hahn airport is a former U.S. military airbase in the state of Rhineland-Palatinate to the west of Frankfurt airport and has a 24-hour operations licence.
It is seeking to establish itself as airport for heavy lift cargo and logistics operations.
